body_html: This helped me understand the seq2seq api: tutorial. What took me a while to realize for whatever reason was that the input to the seq2seq stuff isn't a tensor but a list of size sequence length of tensors of size batch_size by whatever where each element in the list of tensors is just the data for that timestep.
body_text: This helped me understand the seq2seq api: tutorial. What took me a while to realize for whatever reason was that the input to the seq2seq stuff isn't a tensor but a list of size sequence length of tensors of size batch_size by whatever where each element in the list of tensors is just the data for that timestep.
body: This helped me understand the seq2seq api: [tutorial](https://github.com/hans/ipython-notebooks/blob/master/tf/TF%20tutorial.ipynb). What took me a while to realize for whatever reason was that the input to the seq2seq stuff isn't a tensor but a list of size sequence length of tensors of size batch_size by whatever where each element in the list of tensors is just the data for that timestep.
